subject: Career
title: Social Capital: The Currency of Connections
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Social Capital: The Currency of Connections.

hook.text: Two people apply for the same job. One has a referral. She gets the interview. That's social capital.

buildup.text: Sociologist Pierre Bourdieu defined social capital as resources gained through relationships.

discovery.text: Unlike financial capital, social capital grows when you spend it. Helping others increases your value.

twist.text: But it's not infinite. Burning trust through bad referrals depletes your social capital fast.

climax.text: Social capital compounds: good connections lead to more good connections over time.

punchline.text: Your network is your net worth â€” in more ways than money.
